description: From German Intersexe; corresponding to inter- +â€Ž sex.

entries.meaning: (of an individual) Having any of a variety of inherent conditions (in a species with distinct sexes) in which one's sex characteristics differ from those of a typical male and female; for example, having sex characteristics relating to both male and female sexes.
(fantasy) A person who can get pregnant and also impregnate someone else.
The condition of being intersex; intersexuality.
examples: A Canadian believes that he has solved the diagnostic problem in human intersex. All human cells, says Dr. Murray L. Barr of the University of Western Ontario, contain something called sex chromatin.

entries.meaning: (biology, zoology) An individual with any of these conditions.
examples: Pseudo-hermaphrodites or other intersexes are not to be confused with transsexualists; transvestites may be transsexualists, but not necessarily.

verbs.description: intersex (third-person singular simple present intersexes, present participle intersexing, simple past and past participle intersexed)
